clinical_study.brief_title: Short-term Effects Kinesiology Tape on Sitting Postural Control in Moderate and Severe Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: Short-term Effects Kinesiology Tape on Sitting Postural Control in Moderate and Severe Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock: To analyze the short-term effect of kinesiology taping on sitting postural control in moderate and severe cerebral palsy

primary_outcome.measure: Posture and Postural Ability Scale - T0
primary_outcome.description: Posture and Postural Ability Scale pre-intervention (PPAS pre). Score from 0 to 7, and the higher the score, the better posture

primary_outcome.measure: Posture and Postural Ability Scale - T1
primary_outcome.description: Posture and Postural Ability Scale post-intervention (PPAS post). Score from 0 to 7, and the higher the score, the better posture

primary_outcome.measure: Segmental Assessment of Trunk Control - T0
primary_outcome.description: Segmental Assessment of Trunk Control pre-intervention (SATco pre). Score from 1 to 7, and the lower the score, the better balance

primary_outcome.measure: Segmental Assessment of Trunk Control - T1
primary_outcome.description: Segmental Assessment of Trunk Control post-intervention (SATco post).Score from 1 to 7, and the lower the score, the better balance

arm_group.description: Apply a kinesiology taping on the abdominal muscles plus conventional physiotherapy

intervention.description: We used kinesiology taping in abdominal muscles
We used conventional physiotherapy to comparate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age between 4 and 14 years
- diagnosis of motor and cognitive disability
- have prescribed physiotherapy treatment at school
- acquisition of autonomous sitting
- sign the consent informed
Exclusion Criteria:
- presentation of an allergic reaction to tape
- presentation of wounds in the area of application of the tape
- having received botulinum toxin treatment in the last 6 months
